title: Elite Long Jump Performance Behavior Analysis and Instructional Design Project

context.prior_knowledge: Intermediate-level subject-matter expertise and problem-solving abilities
context.additional_context: Learners systematically study and design elite athletes' performance behaviors through long-jump video analysis, peer feedback, and iterative practical tasks. Proficiency in digital tools in a BYOD environment is required.

learning_goals: Learners can analyze a long jumper’s performance behaviors (execution, response, management) through three or more real-world case studies using representative learning design.
Learners can design personalized training scenarios considering individual task constraints (physical, emotional, environmental) and achieve over 80% suitability scores through peer evaluation.
Learners can compare the differences between maximum jump and partial jump strategies from cognitive and emotional perspectives and produce a 5-page report and presentation materials.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
